result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Howard R Jerome was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
case called at 10:14am .[MK]
Defendant Howard R Jerome in court with Attorney Bart D. Achterberg.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Jerome waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
Service of Information admitted, the subject charge and maximum penalties recited
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Jerome guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 2.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Jerome to 3 years and 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years, consecutive to any other sentence in being. 
The Court finds that Mr. Jerome is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Jerome is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Jerome on Probation for three years, with conditions:
--to serve 160 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Work-Release privileges; to commence forthwith (good time credit applies to this jail term)
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Work-release privileges without further process
--the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this jail term to the Columbia County Jail conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring
--to comply with all conditions of the Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol, no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescription drugs only as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and the Agent's approval
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to attend either a Jefferson County or Columbia County Victim Impact Panel
--to comply with the imposed Ignitition Interlock Device requirement
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 
--to pay fine of $3000 plus costs=$4813 (includes $250 DNA surcharge)

The Court orders outright (not as conditions of Probation): 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Jefferson County or Columbia County Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed
recess 10:35am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.
for continuance of the 10/23/14 Motion Hearing

Motion hearing on October 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Copy of letter from the Court to Attorney Achterberg
in Support of Motion (with attached transcript of Plea/Sentencing in cases 02CT2281, 02TR14457 & 02TR14458)
to Bar Consideration of December 11, 2002 Conviction, Defendant's

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 11:08am.
Defendant Howard R Jerome in court with Attorney Bart D. Achterberg.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing and the State has two officer-witnesses present. However Attorney Achterberg files a collateral attack motion and indicates that if his challenge to a second offense conviction is successful, the subject charge in this case will become a misdemeanor 4th offense. 
When the Court indicates its intent to proceed with the Preliminary Hearing today because the officers are present, Attorney Achterberg indicates that he is not prepared to proceed to Preliminary Hearing today.
Attorney Achterberg confirms the Defense waiver of time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
The Court clarifies to Attorney Achterberg that he will need to file the collateral attack motion in Dane County and have it heard there.  
The Court will schedule a Status in approximately 45 days; if counsel find that the the motion was successful, then the State is to be prepared with the filing of an amended complaint; if the motion is not sucessful, the Court intends to re-set the case for Prelim.
recess 11:17am. 

NEXT:  schedule Status Conference in approximately 45 days
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 8:57am.
Defendant Howard R Jerome not in court. Attorney Bart D. Achterberg not in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today and Officer R. Hall is present in the courtroom gallery as the State's witness. 
ADA Hall indicates that she now realizes that a stipulation for continuance was signed by Attorney Acterberg and that ADA Hall believes that she signed it and it should have been submitted to the Court.  This continuance was done to allow time for Attorney Achterberg to look into whether he should pursue a collateral attack on a previous conviction. 
The Court indicates that it will reschedule the hearing. 
recess 8:58am. 

NEXT:  reschedule Preliminary Hearing
Copy of State's DFD sent to Atty Achterberg; Copy made and sent back to DAs office, per JG
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible & requested SPD appear for bond purposes only
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 23, 2014 at 02:20 pm.
Criminal complaint with defendants DOB corrected in the Courts own hand

[clerk: MK]
case called at 1:59pm. 
Defendant Howard R Jerome appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears with Mr. Jerome for bond purposes only).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Jerome indicates that his correct date of birth is September 18, 1976.  
On Motion of the State, the Court amends the Criminal Complaint to correct the date of birth. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.   
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--not to drive a motor vehicle
--Mr. Jerome is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on Thursday July 10th at 2:00pm.

The Court informs Mr. Jerome of his right to counsel; constructive waiver of counsel warnings are given. 
recess 2:09pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/23/14 at 2:20pm.  (2) Preliminary Hearing on 8/11/14 at 8:30am.
